page.title: 11RELIGION IN ST.IVES.
page.content: In a town named after a saint it is not surprising to find twelve places of worship. Two ancient chapels remain,one at the Island (St.Nicholas) and another at Smeatons pier (St.Leonards) while the site of{St.Ia's}oratory is marked by the{parish church}(founded in 1434). The Zion{Congregational}Church was founded in 1662 but the influence of the{Wesleys}led to the formation of five Methodist churches by different branches. The{Methodists}hold thier annual Whitsun parade through the town, ending in "tea treats" on the Island or Clodgy Point. There is a{Catholic}church on Tregenna Hill ,and the{Salvation Army has its citadel on the wharf.
